QCAlgorithm provides a shortcut method, SR(), for the SharpeRatio indicator. It creates an Indicator object, sets up a consolidator to update the indicator, and then returns the indicator so you can use it in your algorithm.

The following reference table describes the SR method:

SR()1/1

            SharpeRatio QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.SR (
    Symbol                       symbol,
    Int32                        sharpePeriod,
    *Decimal                     riskFreeRate,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<Decimal>         selector
   )

Creates a new RollingSharpeRatio indicator.

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol whose RSR we want.
Int32 sharpePeriod Period of historical observation for sharpe ratio calculation.
*Decimal riskFreeRate (Optional) Risk-free rate for sharpe ratio calculation.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

SharpeRatio - The RollingSharpeRatio indicator for the requested symbol over the specified period

Definition at line 1737 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.


The resolution of the indicator should be greater than or equal to the resolution of the security.

To retrieve the numerical value of the indicator, use its Current.Value attribute.

private SharpeRatio _sr;
// In Initialize()
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
_sr = SR(symbol, sharpePeriod);

// In OnData()
if (_sr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _sr.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.sr = self.SR(symbol, sharpePeriod)

# In OnData()
if self.sr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.sr.Current.Value
